start: Hello! I'm Yamata no Orochi, a bot that uses the AniList API to search for anime and manga.
language: To change my language, use the buttons below, select the one you want:
new_language: The language has been set to: ${new_language}.
already_language: The language is already set to: ${language}.
authenticate: Authenticate your AniList account using the button below.
not_authenticated: You aren't connected to your AniList account. Connect to use this function.
already_authenticated: You are connected to your AniList account. Disconnect to connect to another account.
only_user_command: This command can only be used by users.
not_found: The id provided has no record in the AniList database.
no_results_text:
The searched term has no record in the AniList database.
The bot uses the AniList API to search for information, try searching using the title in romaji or english.
If you believe there was an error, contact one of the administrators at @Yonorochi.
Or try searching for a different term.
no_more_results_text:
No more results to display.
The bot uses the AniList API to search for information, try searching using the title in romaji or english.
If you believe there was an error, contact one of the administrators at @Yonorochi.
Or try searching for a different term.
anime_usage: Use the command followed by an id or title. Examples: â€¢ /anime 123456 â€¢ /anime Naruto You can also use the inline mode using the prefix !a or the button below.
manga_usage: Use the command followed by an id or title. Examples: â€¢ /manga 123456 â€¢ /manga One Piece You can also use the inline mode using the prefix !m or the button below.
user_usage: Use the command followed by an id or username. Examples: â€¢ /user 123456 â€¢ /user Yonorochi You can also use the inline mode using the prefix !u or the button below.
character_usage: Use the command followed by an id or name. Examples: â€¢ /character 123456 â€¢ /character Naruto
how_to_use_inline_text: How to use inline mode? Using one of the prefixes below followed by your id or name/title. Prefixes: â€¢ !a for anime â€¢ !m for manga â€¢ !u for user â€¢ !c for character Examples: â€¢ @YonorochiBot !a Naruto â€¢ @YonorochiBot !m One Piece â€¢ @YonorochiBot !u 123456 â€¢ @YonorochiBot !c Itadori
